p: Using the custom neurodegeneration NanoString codeset, we examined gene expression changes in M83+/− mice expressing Il-10. First, we examined the gene expression changes in PBS injected (non-seeded) M83+/− mice injected with AAV-Il-10 or AAV-GFP. We found that Il-10 expression leads to upregulation of various immune genes, such as complement factors, Ccl8, Fcgr2b, and Trem2 (Fig. 2b and Supplementary Table 5). Il-10 was also robustly upregulated (log2 fold change = 10.53; P = 5.89 × 10 −7) in these mice but was omitted from the volcano plot in Fig. 2b as it skewed the plot (Fig. 2b and Supplementary Table 5). GO pathway analysis indicates that Il-10 expression induced robust inflammatory signaling characteristic of macrophage activation and presence of an antigenic stimulus (Fig. 2c). Neither M1-type nor M2-type gene expression signatures were significantly enhanced in these mice, though there was a suggestive trend in the M2 signature (Fig. 2d, e; P = 0.32 for M2). Interestingly, we observed that Il-10 expression led to induction of DAM signature (Fig. 2f; P < 0.05), primarily driven by increased expression of Trem2.
